recommendations.title: Landscape Architects
recommendations.also_called: Golf Course Architect, Land Planner, Landscape Architect, Landscape Planner
recommendations.what_they_do: Plan and design land areas for projects such as parks and other recreational facilities, airports, highways, hospitals, schools, land subdivisions, and commercial, industrial, and residential sites.
recommendations.on_the_job: Prepare graphic representations or drawings of proposed plans or designs., Confer with clients, engineering personnel, or architects on landscape projects., Integrate existing land features or landscaping into designs.
knowledges: music, dance, visual arts, drama, or sculpture
skills: Basic Skills
listening to others, not interrupting, and asking good questions
reading work related information
Problem Solving
noticing a problem and figuring out the best way to solve it
People and Technology Systems
thinking about the pros and cons of different options and picking the best one
figuring out how a system should work and how changes in the future will affect it
abilities: listen and understand what people say
pay attention to something without being distracted

outlook.description: New job opportunities are likely in the future.

recommendations.preprocessed_text: landscape architect golf course architect land planner landscape architect landscape planner plan design land area project park recreational facility airport highway hospital school land subdivision commercial industrial residential site prepare graphic representation drawing proposed plan design confer client engineering personnel architect landscape project integrate existing land feature landscaping design

recommendations.title: Animal Scientists
recommendations.also_called: Animal Nutritionist, Animal Scientist, Beef Cattle Nutritionist, Research Scientist
recommendations.what_they_do: Conduct research in the genetics, nutrition, reproduction, growth, and development of domestic farm animals.
recommendations.on_the_job: Study nutritional requirements of animals and nutritive values of animal feed materials., Write up or orally communicate research findings to the scientific community, producers, and the public., Develop improved practices in feeding, housing, sanitation, or parasite and disease control of animals.
knowledges: arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, or statistics
skills: Basic Skills
reading work related information
thinking about the pros and cons of different ways to solve a problem
Problem Solving
noticing a problem and figuring out the best way to solve it
People and Technology Systems
thinking about the pros and cons of different options and picking the best one
figuring out how a system should work and how changes in the future will affect it
abilities: make general rules or come up with answers from lots of detailed information
choose the right type of math to solve a problem
technologies: Deoxyribonucleic acid DNA sequence analysis software
Data base user interface and query software

outlook.description: New job opportunities are very likely in the future.

recommendations.title: Anthropologists & Archeologists
recommendations.also_called: Archaeologist, Communication and Folklore Specialist, Forensic Anthropologist, Researcher
recommendations.what_they_do: Study the origin, development, and behavior of human beings. May study the way of life, language, or physical characteristics of people in various parts of the world. May engage in systematic recovery and examination of material evidence, such as tools or pottery remaining from past human cultures, in order to determine the history, customs, and living habits of earlier civilizations.
recommendations.on_the_job: Collect information and make judgments through observation, interviews, and review of documents., Teach or mentor undergraduate and graduate students in anthropology or archeology., Write about and present research findings for a variety of specialized and general audiences.
skills: Basic Skills
talking to others
writing things for co-workers or customers
Problem Solving
noticing a problem and figuring out the best way to solve it
People and Technology Systems
thinking about the pros and cons of different options and picking the best one
figuring out how a system should work and how changes in the future will affect it
abilities: make general rules or come up with answers from lots of detailed information

outlook.description: New job opportunities are very likely in the future.
